page.title: 08St. Luke's Church
page.content: St.Luke's Church is a modern building. It was built 26 years ago after the former building was burnt down.It is an Anglican Church. There are no stained glass wondows. The style is very simple.The church faces North, so the traditional East window actually faces to the North.There is a side Chapel in the church.The organ,taken from another church,is 110 years old. There is an RAF flag flying in the church, which was left in Hawkinge when the Aerodrome closed in 1961. There are 2 services on a Sunday and one on a Thursday. There is an active choir. The congregation is usually about 30 people. The church holds over 200 people. The Rector is Rev.John Chittenden.
